App description:
*Join the gang in the new Haunting Horrors level and gussy up the squirrels with 12 new skins!*

WARNING: This is a highly addictive VR game and must be played with at least two other people who join the game on mobile devices.

The golden acorns are under attack! Its up to you and your friends to protect them or steal them in the new cross-platform party game, Acron: Attack of the Squirrels!, from Resolution Games.

A game thats at its best when played as a couch party game together with a group of friends, Acron: Attack of the Squirrels! is both competitive and cooperative in nature for players across VR and mobile devices.

In this hilariously fun experience, one player in VR takes on the role of a large, ancient tree that is the sole protector of the golden acorns. Meanwhile, two to eight frenemies can then grab their iOS and Android devices to become rebel squirrels that'll do anything to steal the golden acorns using an arsenal of unique abilities.

PRIVACY POLICY
Resolution Games AB, a Swedish corporation, with registered and business offices at Sergels torg 12, 111 57, Stockholm, Sweden (Resolution Games) respects your privacy and provides you with this Privacy Policy (Privacy Policy) so that you may understand the ways in which we do and do not use the information you transmit when accessing and playing the Resolution Games Games, accessing and using websites, platforms, software services and related services (hereinafter the Game). 1. Definitions 
Applicable Data Protection Legislation means any legislation in force from time to time which implements the European Union Directive 95/46/EC and Directive 2002/58/EC and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) 2016/679 of April 27th, 2016 and is applicable to this Agreement and all other applicable laws and regulations that may apply to the transfer of Personal Data.
Personal Data shall mean any information relating to a Data subject; an identifiable person is one who can be defined, directly or indirectly, notably by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier, or to one or more factors specific to his/her physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person. Contact data and Service Data are Personal Data.
Contact Data means any names, phone numbers, e-mail addresses and certain financial details held within commercial systems to conduct the Parties relationship management and billing transactions between the Parties;
Controller, Data Subject, Personal Data, Process/Processing and Processor, shall have the same meaning as in the European Union Directive 95/46/EC or the General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679 of April 27th, 2016.
Service Data means any Partys Personal Data (that is not Contact Data) held within the Parties systems, applications or databases and that may be accessed, processed, used or stored as a consequence of performing the services under the Agreement.
Third Country means a country that is: (i) outside of the European Economic Area; and (ii) not the subject of a formal decision by the European Commission, made pursuant to Section 25(6) of the European Union Directive 95/46/EC or under Article 45 (1) of the General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679, stating that that country ensures an adequate level of protection for personal Data.

3. Cookies and logs etc.
Cookies. A cookie is information a website, app or platforms places on your computers hard drive or devices etc. so that the website, app or platform is able to remember your preferences and/or which pages you visited on the website/app/platform and make your visit more efficient and enjoyable. Resolution Games may use cookies to determine the number of unique players of the Game over a given period, or to remember user account details, etc. so that the need for multiple log-ins is eliminated. It may combine information collected through cookies to any Personal Data submitted online when using the Game to help personalize a users access to and playing of the Game. Cookies may be disabled on your computer by indicating this in the preferences or options menus in your browser.
Logfiles. Log files are files that log actions that have occurred on a website, app or platform. Resolution Games may collect data in the form of log files and may use such log files to gather statistics about End Users user habits and to assess overall Game activity, including how many hits; a particular web page etc. is getting and other navigational data. These entries are generated anonymously, and enable Resolution Games and/or platforms to track interest in specific promotions, features, troubleshoot technical concerns, and provide End Users with content that may be of interest to them. Log files are used internally only, and are not associated with any particular user, computer, or browser.
Web beacons. The Game may use a variety of technical methods for tracking purposes, including Web beacons etc. Web beacons are small pieces of data that are embedded in images on the pages of the Game. We may also use these technical methods to analyze the traffic patterns in the Game such as the frequency with which End Users accesses various parts of the Game etc. These technical methods may involve the transmission of information either directly to us or to another party authorized by us to collect information on our behalf. The information from use of these technical methods may be collected in a form that is personally identifiable.

10. Your Choices and Controls
You have the following rights regarding your Personal Data:
The right to request access
In accordance to Chapter III, Article 15 of the GDPR a Data Subject may request access to processed Personal Data. This includes confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the following information:
the purposes of the processing;
the categories of Personal Data concerned;
the recipients or categories of recipient to whom the Personal Data have been or will be disclosed, in particular recipients in third countries or international organizations;
where possible, the envisaged period for which the personal data will be stored or, if not possible, the criteria used to determine that period;
the existence of the right to request from the controller rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing of personal data concerning the data subject or to object to such processing;
the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority;
where the Personal Data are not collected from you, any available information as to the source;
the existence of automated decision-making, including profiling, referred to in Article 22(1) and (4) and, at least in those cases, meaningful information about the logic involved, as well as the significance and the envisaged consequences of such processing for the data subject.
Where Personal Data are transferred to a third country or to an international organization, you have the right to be informed of the appropriate safeguards pursuant to Article 46 relating to the transfer.
You shall be provided a copy of the Personal Data undergoing processing. For any further copies requested, we may charge a reasonable fee based on administrative costs. Where you make the request by electronic means, and unless otherwise requested by you, the information shall be provided in a commonly used electronic form. The right to obtain a copy shall not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others. Please note that the access may be restricted due to intellectual property rights or trade secrets.
The right to object
You have the right to object to the Personal Data processing on grounds relating to your particular situation when the data are processed based on the balancing-of-interest rule in Article 6(1)(f) of the GDPR, see Article 21 of the GDPR. In this case, we will cease the processing unless there are compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests, rights and freedoms or if the processing is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defense of legal claims. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data for direct marketing purposes at any time. We will cease the processing of your Personal Data for this purpose after the objection. Please note that if you exercise this right, your user license to use the Game and related services will cease automatically.
Right of correction and erasure
You have the right to have inaccurate Personal Data rectified, in accordance with Article 16 of the GDPR.
You have the right to have your Personal Data erased where one of the following grounds applies, see Article 17 of the GDPR:
The Personal Data is no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which it was collected or otherwise processed,
if you have withdrawn your consent and there are no other legal grounds for the processing,
if you have objected to the processing and there are no overriding legitimate grounds for the processing,
the Personal Data have to be erased for compliance with a legal obligation in Union or Member State law,
the Personal Data have been unlawfully processed or
the Personal Data have been collected in relation to the offer of information society services.
Please note that your right to erasure may be limited if the data are necessary for compliance with a legal obligation or for the establishment, exercise or defense of legal claims.
The right to restriction
You have the right to obtain restriction of processing in certain circumstances, in accordance with Article 18 of the GDPR. If you have the right to restriction, we will only process your Personal Data with your consent or for the establishment, exercise or defense of a legal claim or to protect a person or important grounds of public interest.
The right to withdraw consent 
If we have asked for your consent to our processing of your Personal Data, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time, in accordance with Article 7 of the GDPR. You may at any time opt out of and/or unsubscribe from emails from Resolution Games and our service providers, or withdraw consent to Personal Data storage, either via the unsubscribe link included in the emails, or by emailing privacy@resolutiongames.com. If you withdraw your consent, we will cease processing of the Personal Data for which you have withdrawn consent, unless we have a legal obligation to keep some or parts of your data. Please note that if you withdraw your consent, your right to play the Game and related services will cease automatically. The withdrawal of your consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing based on your consent before its withdrawal.
The right to data portability
You have the right to receive your Personal Data that you have provided to us in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hinderance if the processing is based on consent or contract performance, sin accordance with Article 20 of the GDPR.
Changing or Removing Account Information
Access and control over most Personal Data in the Game is readily available through the profile editing tools on your account with the applicable platform/service provider that you are accessing the game through. End Users may modify or delete any or all of their profile information at any time by logging into their accounts. Information will be updated as soon as possible. End Users who wish to deactivate their Game account may do so in their accounts with the applicable platform/service provider that you are accessing the game through. Removed information may persist in backup copies for a reasonable period of time but will not be generally available to other End Users or visitors of the Game. You cannot however remove communications made in any communication features in the Game, which might have been shared with other End Users (for example sending personal messages to another End Users).

If you wish to invoke any of the rights described above, you may contact us at any time by emailing us at privacy@resolutiongames.com. We will process and answer your requests without undue delay and in any event within one month of our receipt of the request unless a longer period is required due to the complexity of the request. In this case, our response time can be up to three months in total as permitted by Article 12 of the GDPR.

TinyTexanJun 2 at 7:10 PM
Good game, left alone for too long.

This game is fun. Not many sides about it.
However, it becomes a lot less fun when you realize the game isnt balanced, and you have to do that yourself.

What I mean by this is that:
1. The characters were not tweaked, and arent equally good (example, zip is not fast enough with his ability to make an actual difference. Basically useless). Devs need to make the character more even. Not making them worse, but making the bad characters better and the good characters the same (good characters are chunk and Doug). Another detail is that the player count doesnt change the game to balance it. The tree will basically always lose if there is more than 3 players, and the squirrels have a pretty hard time with 2 unless you work well together. Id appreciate a change in map choice, power up amount, or character power when the player count is higher or lower. This would almost infinitely make this game better.

2. Also, there is very little customization. The fact that you cant choose the map, and that you cant customize your experience beyond a minimal level makes the game a lot less fun to play.

And with that, my final remarks. The game is pretty good, and highly suggest it if you like to share your headset with friends or family. However, this game is pretty surface level and gets a little boring without fun people to play with. So, devs, I like this game enough that if you balance this game even a little bit, I will be glad to support it strongly.
Thanks for reading.

brandagsJun 9 at 2:03 PM
So much fun!

My family of 5 has spent several evenings playing Acron together. And we invited friends over twice to play it (9 people total). Every time was a blast! It's fun being both a squirrel and the tree. (Though I think it's more fun to be the tree.)
The levels are interesting and challenging. Mixing that with the squirrels abilities adds a good strategic element. We have found that some levels are much harder for the squirrels than other levels, so it's a little tricky to figure out when to take turns as the tree so everyone gets a fair chance.
One struggle we've had with it is when you're the squirrel and you have a acorn, running back to the base is very hard because the camera continues to face forward, so you can't see where you're running. There are arrows to help, but sometimes we end up running off a cliff or into an obstacle that shouldn't have happened. It would be better if, as a squirrel, I was able to adjust the camera angle. Even a first person mode might be fun, and make me feel more "in" the game.
But overall, it's a fantastic game to play with friends, and I would love to see more variations on this theme. I don't just mean new levels, but new games where one person is in the vr headset and the rest on other devices. But other themes could be preventing alien attacks, or defending a castle, although I admit the squirrel/tree idea is really fun and creative and good for all ages. Thank you for making this!

PhenoramApr 28 at 5:39 PM
Best Local Game

Edit: 5 months later

This is the best local multiplayer game on the Quest. Frankly, it's an under-tapped market.
Not much to say. It's a lot of fun. 2-8 people on mobile devices play as squirrels, stealing the acorns from the VR player (a tree). I've played this a lot. My entire family have become quick fans: siblings, parents, even grandparents! Everyone requests it when we get all together.

There's definitely no tutorial for the squirrels; the tutorial the devs point out is for the tree. Not a big deal because it's fairly intuitive, but it'd be helpful.

The game supplies decent AI squirrels, but you're required to have at least 2 mobile users to start... why... I get it's meant to be a multiplayer game, and that's definitely how it's most fun. But... just let us play solo if we want.

Much needed improvements:
1. Add greater customization to games for users to adjust: change round length, change number of acorns, etc. A good tree can get unbalanced, and some simple adjustments like that would help.
2. Since it's designed as a local party game, it would be nice to have a better HMD-sharing mode. Like, after X rounds it switches to a new person. And something that could keep track of the trees would be fun for points and friendly competition.
3. Allow for solo play. You literally already have AI enemy squirrels, it's just silly that you REQUIRE 3 players to even start a game.

There are a few glitches: when loading in, the most recent squirrel gets labeled "player name".
Often when chunk gets hit while holding an acorn and shield, he'll go flying across the screen.
Sometimes the acorn will glitch around the screen, seems to happen in tunnels most of the time.


Honestly, don't let that discourage you. It's more for the devs than players. It's a really, really well-made game. It's wildly fun. Definitely the best on the market right now. For real, I recommend it to everyone.

jelwellJan 11 at 3:40 PM
Maybe good if you have 4+ players

With 3 or fewer players this game is sadly one sided. The Tree always wins.

Pros:
VR features (throwing things and moving in place) work really well.
Different squirrel abilities (builder, digger, etc) gives the game a good helping of replay-ability.
The game is pretty fun.

Cons:
Squirrels can't see when returning to base - the camera angle is always pointed at the tree. The Developer had said, repeatedly that this is intentional. But it means that on levels with water, or voids the squirrels fall in before they even see the drop. And if there is a ledge the squirrels just get stuck. If you're trying to nerf the squirrels by making them memorize the maps then I personally think the game just isn't well thought out.
AI is dumb. There are a couple of levels with water and drop offs and the AI simply never makes it back to the base with an acorn even if (as the tree) I throw NOTHING. Sadly this means that you can't make up for lacking enough friends by adding CPU players.
Requires a ton of friends and phones! I would increase my rating considerably if I could play online with strangers, or add an arbitrary amount of CPU players to my room. As it is I have 3 phones/tablets in my house and 1 headset. The best I can do is add 3 squirrels to my game, then after the game starts I have one of the tablets disconnect (because I don't actually have 3 friends to play with) - then a CPU takes over.
Can not pick the levels. My 7 year old daughter (like the CPU ai) can NOT manage to cross voids/water without dying. Would be nice if I could specify which level I want when she is playing a squirrel.

It's possible that, as squirrel players get more experience playing the game will self balance. However there needs to be a way to nerf the Tree until then
I would say that if the Developers somehow fix the game balance (allow more CPUs, allow online matchmaking, or nerf the tree?), and fix the squirrel camera view this could easily be my favorite party game. And would warrant 5 stars

jacobphilliDec 26 at 6:43 AM
Great party game

Eventually I hope there is an offline/AI mode for single player or an online public lobby for match making, but for now it is still a great party game.

Players download an app and choose from four characters with unique abilities. They then work together to steal gold acorns from below the tree, who is controlled in VR.

Its fun communicating as a team to build bridges, shield each other, or toss the acorn just before you die and have a teammate swoop it up and continue bringing it to your base.

Its also fun to be inside and see your friends names over their characters running at you. The three types of ammo the tree can throw allow for strategy and you definitely develop more skill with practice.

There are enough environments that you can play several games in a row and not feel repetitive, plus switching who gets to be the tree and different teams of squirrels makes it fun.

wildBcatAug 30, 2019 at 10:30 AM
Nonstop fun!

I have been waiting for more party games for the Oculus Quest, so I was excited when this came. The hard thing about party games is trying to get everyone up to speed on how to play and teaching the person using the headset what to do. Plus they can be a little buggy, since they are interfacing with other devices. Thats what makes this game so awesome!
Setup is simple. The people with phones enter their name and the connection code. The person with the headset gives the connection code and waits for everyone to join. Thats it! For its maiden voyage I did not find anything buggy about it, for both the headset or the phone app.
Gameplay was straightforward and easy to figure out, yet the gameplay is engaging enough to keep you interested. I tried it with adults and with kids and it seemed to be engaging for both. I love that there are different types of squirrels and different environments. I also love blue there were certain hidden tricks to improve gameplay that you learn as you go.
The game play at first will feel like the tree is a little overpowered, but once you learn how to use the squirrels abilities as a team it becomes super hard for the tree and everything balances out. There isnt a single player mode on the app or the headset, but the headset had a tutorial game that is engaging enough. Id love to see the same on the phone app. I also love that the phone app is free. The graphics are great on this, and there seemed to be very few laggy situations. They even give the tree the ability to see the network and connection statistics during game play!
As long as two squirrels play you can have up to 8 (which is amazing!). It will fill in with AI squirrels until others join (which they can do mid game). Such a fun game! Completely worth the money.

Vargo.CopperspoonSep 13, 2019 at 5:42 AM
Game is a BLAST but needs polish! <3

Right, this game is excellent as a concept. Fantastic use of the Quest. However - there are a number of bugs/weird interactions that kindof ruin it. I'm going to get into that part, but given that this is a public review and I really do love this game I want to lead with the positive. This game is an absolute blast, and now reigns supreme as my favoured way to introduce new players to VR as a concept. Really easy to set up games, no noticeable lag even on my dodgy internet. Interesting class choices with surprising depth for only having one button different between them, yet above all stands the experience of playing a goddamn raid boss. Nothing is quite like snapping around your heels trying to predict the movement of squirrels only to snatch one off the floor. I literally cannot help myself lifting them to eye level to revel in having caught them, and to take a moment thinking of where would be most pleasing to hurl them - even though it's a proper waste of time. It's so instantly immersive that I can't help a bit of impromptu larp xD top marks on that part. Haven't really found a fault on the tree side of this and despite the bugs and whatnot I've encountered on the squirrel side of things - I wish I could just show you all footage of my 5'nothing friend cackling as they murdered us. Indeed - I recommend filming your friends when they first get to try it out. Just - make sure they're real familiar with how the guardian boundaries work, we've already lost a full mug of tea and a plate to enthusiastic squirrel-hurling xD


Now - on to the issues. I want to be constructive here as I'm aware this is early days and the Devs seem pretty receptive. I'll say this first though - the whole mandatory added players thing isn't one of them. It's a multiplayer game! Just, let them make the game they're trying to make people. Stop whinging about the lack of single player. Sure it would be cool - but I'd much rather they devoted their resources to making the multiplayer experience more refined. Anyway, with that said, moving swiftly onwards ~


1) due to how small the screen space is on the phone, it's super difficult to tell where exactly some stuff is when you're trying to run back to the base. Also, there's sooo many spots where you seem to get irrevocably stuck, and the only option is to kill yourself to respawn. One level has a ledge you can fall onto, but can't seem to escape? Maybe I'm being dumb, but that seems pretty counter intuitive. I don't want to suggest hobbling level design variety - but could you maybe let them use their roll to get up diagonal surfaces? Idk jack about the kind of coding this would involve/weird knock-on effects it could result in, so apologies if that's a silly suggestion/if my lack of base knowledge similarly invalidates any further suggestions in this review!


2) the tunnels the digger makes can be suuper glitchy. Sometimes due to the turning circle of the squirrels, you exit one, try to do something, and then endlessly bounce back and forth re-entering the same tunnel. Also sometimes they just legit don't work at all - I wind up spinning in circles trying to enter one and I don't want to kick off about it in the group as the person playing the tree is clearly having a wonderful time, but the frustration mounts pretty quickly.


3) the giant boulder things the tree throws remain lethal on contact even when they're just lying there, and sometimes they literally come to a rest *on the spawn point*. This is exceedingly frustrating and instantly kills the mood for whoever just gets stuck by it. Idk - maybe have an area that automatically shoves stuff away around the spawn point? Or have it somehow covered? Currently - if the trees aim is good enough they can just put one there and the only thing stopping them is politeness.


4) I truly understand (or, have sympathy for at least) the limitations you're working with on a phone app - but there are a few instances where the movement controls are a huge barrier. The process of getting to grips with the one that builds bridges isn't clever positioning of them, but rather figuring out how to not fall off. Maybe if you made a like, context sensitive button for interacting with certain movement situations? It could kill two glitchy bits with one stone as you could press it to dive off the path and use the same button space for entering tunnels? Have them light up ever so slightly when you're in range of them maybe? Being able to run around without having to tiptoe about for fear of just falling off would make the bridge class so much more engaging.


5) occasionally tunnels will wind up coming out in water, which the players can aim to avoid - but given one of the joys of this is how easy it is to pick up new players and introduce them to VR with this thing, I feel like barriers for entry should be considered at the absolute neophyte stage. We learned not to do it after a bit but it's still pretty frustrating and having them clip to either side of the river would be great. This sort of comes back to the invalid game state issue with ledges.


Thinking back to that - would it be possible to have a small button that briefly, while you're holding your thumb on it flips up a map for reference? Have a little ring that fades in around where you are to draw your eye. I think intrusive indicators would be annoying over normal gameplay given the space they'd take up, but an easier way to get your bearings would be awesome. It makes sense for the camera angle to be locked on the tree - all the information you need to react to is in that direction and it's imperative that the shield squirrel keeps his shield in the right direction, but losing because you accidentally trap yourself/derp into a river feels like you've been robbed, rather than the tree doing something clever.


Phew. End rant. I'd like to take a moment to repeat that I desperately want to give this game five stars and will gleefully amend my review as stuff gets resolved. The concept is excellent and I love what VR as a medium is now exploring with different perspectives/asymmetric experiences in general. Makes me want to learn how to make them myself. Keep up the good work - this game is already a lot of fun, and every hole in the immersion that gets plugged can only add to that <3
